description: Move you camera until white dots will display in your screen. Touch at any white dots to start your learning!
Welcome, young biologists! Today, we're venturing into the fascinating world of
reproduction! Get ready to flex your scientific muscles and solve the mystery asexual or sexual reproduction?
We'll be analyzing images to see if they represent asexual
reproduction (one parent) or sexual reproduction (two parents).
A strawberry plant sending out runners?
A seahorse giving birth to live young?
A starfish regenerating a lost limb?
Good Job! You got a perfect score!
Now, let's solidify our understanding with some examples!  For each type of
Asexual Reproduction (Plant): (example) Potato growing from a single eye
Asexual Reproduction (Animal): (example) Hydra reproducing by budding
Sexual Reproduction (Plant): (example) Flowering plants reproducing with pollen and ovules
Sexual Reproduction (Animal): (example) Birds laying eggs that are fertilized by sperm
Good Job! You completed the assessment!
